intro: Sedum renzopalmae, commonly known as the Zanzibar sedum, is a succulent plant native to the coastal regions of Zanzibar. It is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit and fleshy, green leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white wax. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the wet season, typically from November to March. It is well adapted to arid and coastal environments, thriving in full sun and well-draining soil. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
